ryanatl wrote:

> I've tried using both 1.4.0 and heritrix-1.5.0-200507120157 and
> receive these errors
> while processing a ARC.  Above and beyond this error, is there any
> switches available to
> keep extractor running in case of an Exception vs. dying altogether?
> This particular
> exception is occuring at the very beginning of a 100MB ARC, so
> obviously lots of possibly
> good data being skipped because of a bad entry.

We're failing on a basic read of the gzipped ARC.   Does it fail each 
time?  What is the output if you do ${HERITRIX_HOME}/bin/arcreader -s 
ARCNAME?  Does it read any records from the ARC (or just not the last)?  
What does gzip -t say about the ARC?  (There are cases where the last 
gzip member in an ARC can be incomplete if Heritrix is shutdown 
improperly (Crash, etc.) but usually in this case the ARCs will still 
have the '.open' extension).
Thanks,
St.Ack
